full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/7/2023 Pierre 36.2 UNITED S ES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE 1 IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE DATE: 12/06/96 BRiCE, MARIE AnnA FILE: A 75424782 PLEASE COME TO THIS OFFICE: 7880 BISCAYNE BLVD, ROOM 390, MIAMI, FLORIDA 33138 ON: 07/29/97 AT: 1:00 PM regarding an Immigration matter. Failure to respond to this request may result in denial of your application. BE ON TIME. Late arrival can cause a long delay or postponement of interview. EMERGENCY : If you must cancel this appointment because of an emergency, please indicate below the nature of the emergency and attach evidence of the emergency Sign and date this form and return it to this office immediately. BRING WITH YOU: This letter; an interpreter (if you do not speak English); all documents listed below (any document in a foreign language must be accompanied by a certified English translation). Documents submitted must be originals or certified copies that bear the seal of the issuing authority. Provide an addi- tional photocopy of any original document you wish returned. NOTE: Interview may be video-taped by the Service. BRING YOUR PASSPORT, Birth certificate & original entry document (I-94). IF PETITIONING FOR A SPOUSE: Your spouse must appear with you and bring a valid photo identification, proof of his/her residency or citizenship, present evidence that you and your spouse reside together in a husband/wife relationship; birth certificates of children born of your present marriage; income tax returns, mortgage documents, insurance policies, rent receipts and/or agreements, wedding photographs, bank account and/or credit card records. IF PETITIONING FOR PARENTS OF UNITED STATES CITIZENS: Must present original certificate of birth of the petitioner and if there has been a name change by virtue of marriage, present original marriage license of petitioner. If name change by court decree, present such document. CURRENT MEDICAL REPORT: As soon as you receive this notice, you are required to make arrangements for your medical examination with one of the medical examiners on the attached list of INS- approved physicians who will perform the medical examination, required laboratory procedures, and any necessary chest x-ray. NOTE: Applicants two years of age or older are required to have a tuberculin skin test (Mantoux) as part of the medical examination followed by a chest x-ray if reaction of 5mm or greater. APPLICANTS UNDER 15 YEARS OF AGE ARE NOT ROUTINELY REQUIRED TO HAVE THE TESTS AS PART OF THEIR MEDICAL EXAMINATION. PROOF OF SUPPORT: You and/or any employed family members must present from each employer a letter on official stationery that indicates the position, whether the position is temporary or permanent, current salary, and date of initial employment IF YOU HAVE AT ANY TIME BEEN ARRESTED in any country you must submit the following for EACH arrest: arresting officer's report; indictment (if applicable); and a document showing the disposition of the case. IF YOU ARE THE BENEFICIARY OF AN APPROVED VISA PETITION: Bring copies of all documents submitted with that petition. Mis
